summary: This is a confidential letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Deutsche Bank's seventh production of documents in response to a grand jury subpoena. The production includes Jeffrey Epstein's brokerage account statements and currency transaction reports for cash withdrawals by his associates Darren Indyke and Harry Beller.

connections.description: Indyke is identified as an associate of Epstein who made cash withdrawals from accounts, as evidenced by the Currency Transaction Reports produced by Deutsche Bank.
Beller is identified as an associate of Epstein who made cash withdrawals from accounts, as evidenced by the Currency Transaction Reports produced by Deutsche Bank.
Moyne, as an attorney for Deutsche Bank, is involved in producing financial records related to Epstein's accounts in response to a subpoena, establishing a legal-professional connection.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank, compelling the production of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial activities.

events.title: Seventh Document Production Submitted
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its attorneys at Akin Gump, submitted its seventh rolling production of documents in response to the July 11 subpoena, including Epstein's account statements and CTRs.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was under a grand jury subpoena (dated July 11, 2019) to produce documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The seventh production included account statements for seven Jeffrey Epstein-controlled brokerage accounts.
The production also included ten Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs) filed for cash withdrawals made by Epstein's associates Darren Indyke and Harry Beller.
The letter emphasizes the confidential nature of the production under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e) and asserts that production does not waive any legal privileges.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing, cooperative investigation into Epstein's financial activities through Deutsche Bank.
